item.title: Road surface damaged, 21st February
item.description:
On the right hand bend travelling from Severn Springs towards Air Balloon road surface is badly eroded. Even though travelling at less than 30 mph in run up to major roadwords at Air Balloon, our motorhome was pitched violently to the left by rutting in the road surface. Caused our storage lockers to pop open as van shell was distorted.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A436, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Street, Coberley, Cotswold

item.title: Leaves and mud making pavement impassable, 21st February
item.description:
From a resident: "Four or five times a week I walk down Manor Road to go to Sainsbury's/Tewkesbury Road and in the last couple of months the footpath has been in a terrible condition with both compacted fallen leaves and mud. I'm aware that we've had non-stop road works down there for the last couple of months and more recently the deliveries of manure to the field down the road but in over forty years in the village I can't ever remember the footpath being in such a dreadful condition. Baring in mind that children going to the school use this path I would hate for someone to slip on this often treacherous surface and fall into the road. Is there any chance that the footpath can be cleaned up?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: The sign needs updating, 21st February
item.description:
The sign tells us that "work starts in Summer 2023". Yes we know, we can see and the date is in the past. Clearly what ervyone wants to know now, is when does the work finish. This always happens - eg the works on the A40 past GCHQ
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Significant potholes, 21st February
item.description:
A series of potholes on road while heading East. These are inline with where a car's tires would be so are causing damage. Due to narrowness and bendiness of road it is impossible to avoid these. This has been present for years. Why was this not resolved when the road was closed off for resurfacing in January? Some of these potholes are only a few metres away from where the road was resurfaced.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 21st February
item.description:
email rcvd 09.02.24 - Lansdown Parade, Cheltenham, GL50 2LH. We constantly have a blocked drain right at the front if our house. It covers more than half the road as you can see in the photos attached. We canâ€™t park outside our property and when we walk out our drive we can get soaked with passing cars spraying us. We understand it has been very wet lately but this problem has been constant. You do have people sweeping leaves now and then, but the never pick them up, they just leave piles which blow around and re distribute! What can you do to help us please?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 21st February
item.description:
There are some v large rotten limbs on this tree which if they fall could cause fatality to a passerby in car or fall on to the cars in my driveway. I have reported this now over two years - no one has done anything about it. Your tree man who pruned tree in road opposite agreed with me and i reported it then It requires immediate attention, some fell last week in heavy winds - i have branch here if you want to see it!!
Report on FixMyStreet
